intro: Pseudolysimachion linariifolium subsp. dilatatum, commonly known as the broad-leaved linariifolium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Violaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. The flowers are small and typically violet or blue in color, arranged in dense spikes. This subspecies is native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia. It prefers moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grassy or rocky habitats.
